item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 5, 2025 at 4:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The day I taught AI to read code like a Senior Developer (157 points | 68 comments)
2. How Nat Traversal Works (2020) (159 points | 33 comments)
3. Supernovae evidence for foundational change to cosmological models (28 points | 10 comments)

6. A story on home server security (115 points | 148 comments)
7. The Evolution of Tunnel Boring Machines (2023) (34 points | 18 comments)

9. You Wouldn't Download an AI (67 points | 16 comments)
10. Counterculture legend who invented bell-bottom jeans dies at 84 (32 points | 13 comments)
11. Nanoimprint Lithography Aims to Take on EUV (83 points | 47 comments)
12. Self Unhelped (9 points | discuss)

14. Combining 15s interval whole-sky-camera photos to form a 4y spanning keogram (468 points | 69 comments)
15. University of Alabama Engineer Pioneers New Process for Recycling Plastics (123 points | 127 comments)
16. AI's next leap requires intimate access to your digital life (22 points | 23 comments)

20. Sailor Poets Take over U.S. Navy Deck Logs on New Year's Day (47 points | 9 comments)

22. Myst Markdown – Markdown for technical/scientific document (122 points | 20 comments)
23. ELKS: Linux for 16-bit Intel Processors (181 points | 92 comments)
24. Refurb Weekend: Atari Stacy (59 points | 2 comments)
25. Discuo – Anonymous discussions with infinite branching and 24h lifespan (27 points | 37 comments)
26. The funniest thing I ever did – a.k.a. "How To Make $100K From A Dick Joke." (150 points | 50 comments)
27. The comb jelly can fuse with another (including nervous and digestive systems) (74 points | 17 comments)
28. One Dog vs. the Windows 3.1 Graphics Stack (211 points | 77 comments)
29. Hacker gains access to the RP2350 OTP secret by glitching the RISC-V cores (163 points | 24 comments)
30. Hornet, RNA structure visualization method correlates sequence and 3D topology (29 points | 6 comments)
